image.altText: Marion Railway Station in Adelaide's south.

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old man accused of sexually assaulting a child on the Seaford rail line faces court, with a police prosecutor describing the alleged attack as "random" and the victim as being in a "severe state of shock".

title.children: Child was sexually assaulted along Adelaide rail line in 'random' attack, court told

image.altText: A man in glasses smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Adam Troy Bennett has been handed a 13-year sentence, with a non-parole period of 10 years, for killing Peter Hillier during a drunken fightÂ on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula in 2022.

title.children: Man sentenced to at least 10 years in jail over 'savage beating' of travel companion

image.altText: A male tennis player in an orange shirt, playing a two-handed backhand shot.

props.synopsis: Australia's top-ranked men's player Alex de Minaur begins his Australian Open on Rod Laver Arena against Milos Raonic. Follow live.

title.children: Alex de Minaur loses opening set to Raonic in tie-break

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Jordan Thompson defeats Aleksandar Vukic in five-set struggle
Live score: Hurkacz wins first set over Australian in tie-break
Live score: Raonic wins the first set in a tie-break

image.altText: A gas platform in the Timor Sea.

props.synopsis: Santos has been granted permission to resume laying an underwater pipeline for its Barossa gas project, north of Darwin, after winning a legal battle against a group of Tiwi Islands elders.

title.children: Santos wins legal battle against Tiwi Islands elders over $5.7b Barossa gas pipeline

image.altText: A close-up of Zain Khan's face, he appears to have dark curly hair and a long beard.

props.synopsis: The man accused of driving dangerously through the Melbourne CBD in September last year, in a deadly incident in which pedestrians and motorists were struck, has pleaded not guilty and will now face a trial in the Supreme Court.

title.children: Alleged Bourke Street driver pleads not guilty to murder

image.altText: Police remove a black and yellow suitcase from a home

props.synopsis: Police say the officers at the home are child abuse detectives who are in Broome as part of an ongoing investigation into historic child sex offences.

title.children: Former home of Broome Catholic Bishop Christopher Saunders raided by police

image.altText: police station in adelaides north western surburbs

props.synopsis: The recent death of a police officer at a station in Adelaide's north-western suburbs will be referred to a parliamentary committee into mental health support for the profession.

title.children: SA police officer's death to be referred to parliamentary committee on police mental health

image.altText: A man looks off camera with a considered expression

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has made progress ticking off hundreds of commitments made to taxpayers before the March 2022 election. But it still has a long way to go on key areas like health, integrity and cost-of-living, writes Stephanie Richards and Rory McClaren.

title.children: The biggest political hurdles the SA government will face in 2024

image.altText: An aerial photo of a house gutted by flames

props.synopsis: A bushfire north of Perth has torn through a property that was earmarked for a luxury $100 million country club marketed towards high-rolling international tourists.

title.children: 'Rich listers playground' plan in limbo after fire destroys property on land earmarked for $100m country club

image.altText: A man crying while his family stands next to him

props.synopsis: After his mother put in her two weeks notice on New Year's Eve, the newly minted King Frederik X has been proclaimed monarch of Denmark. Here's everything that happened while you were asleep.Â

title.children: Denmark's King Frederik wanted a low-key accession. But one thing he saw brought him to tears

image.altText: King Frederik and Queen Mary kiss while standing on a balcony

props.synopsis: Near-freezing temperatures have not stopped the Danish from welcoming their new king, Frederik X, and his Australian-born wife, Queen Mary. Here are some of the best photos of the Nordic nation's first royal succession in half a century.

title.children: Tears, cheers and Australian flags as Denmark welcomes new king and queen

image.altText: Three people standing in a kitchen, with one of them in a red digital circle.

props.synopsis: Confronting footage of an unprovoked and knife attack inside at an East Perth back packers hostel is played to the WA Supreme Court, as the man responsible argued he was not of sound mind at the time.

title.children: Court sees distressing footage of unprovoked stabbing attack at Perth backpackers hostel

image.altText: A Woolworths Metro in the Brisbane suburb of Teneriffe is spray painted with profanities.

props.synopsis: A Woolworths Metro in the Brisbane suburb of Teneriffe is spray painted with profanities surrounding the Australia Day controversy, with the apartment building above evacuated after a flare was set off.

title.children: Video shows Brisbane Woolworths being vandalised, flare thrown amid Australia Day merchandise controversy

image.altText: Dash cam still showing person holding item in tray of ute on highway.

props.synopsis: Employees of the Big Bash League cricket team Hobart Hurricanes are caught out after dash cam vision shows a team-branded ute travelling on a major highway with a person riding in the tray holding a large box.

title.children: Dash cam catches out Hobart Hurricanes employee's ute tray ride on highway

image.altText: A night view of a spreading patch of burning lava.

props.synopsis: Houses have been set on fire in the Icelandic town of Grindavik, after two volcanic fissures erupted nearby. It is the second volcanicÂ eruption on the Reykjanes peninsula in south-west Iceland in less than a month.

title.children: Iceland's Grindavik volcano erupts, setting fire to homes as island 'tears itself apart'

image.altText: Collage of Andrew Forrest, Jeff Bezos and Gina Rineheart

props.synopsis: The world's wealthiest five men have more than doubled their fortune since 2020, while three ofÂ the richest Australians have seen their wealth double at a staggering rate of $1.5 million per hour,Â the charity Oxfam says.

title.children: World's wealthiest could spend $1.5 million a day for 476 years, new report reveals

image.altText: Jabiru sign.jpg

props.synopsis: A boy, aged nine, has been bitten near Jabiru, the biggest town in Kakadu, sustaining a number of puncture wounds.

title.children: Boy critically injured in Kakadu crocodile attack

image.altText: A wood heater in a house.

props.synopsis: Researchers call for new wood heaters to be banned from urban areas and for existing ones to be phased out after their study shows their smoke may be killing up to 63 people a year in the ACT alone.

title.children: Wood heater smoke estimated to kill up to 63 in Australian city each year, prompting calls for national ban

image.altText: A series of Nauru flags fly in front of a palm tree.

props.synopsis: Nauru announces it is severing diplomatic relations with Taiwan and will recognise China, becoming Taipei's first diplomatic ally to switch to Beijing following the weekend's presidential election.

title.children: Taiwan loses first ally post-election as Nauru goes over to China

image.altText: America Ferrera in a born evening gown clutching an award and Margot Robbie in a red evening gown, both smiling

props.synopsis: While Barbie didn't go home with all the awards it was nominated for at the 29th annual Critics Choice Awards, it was a good night for the Margot Robbie-produced movie, with America Ferrera being recognised and host Chelsea Handler declaring this the "year of the woman".

title.children: Barbie shines at the Critics Choice Awards

image.altText: A man in an orange shirt, facing away, sits in a car with the doors open.

props.synopsis: About 70,000 people live in Australia unlawfully. To avoid getting caught, Shan had to go undergroundÂ â a path he warns no-one should walk.

title.children: When police pulled Shan over, he knew his secret life had just come undone

image.altText: A young man in a black suit and black hat walks past half-constructed homes on an arid hill

props.synopsis: The federal government has denounced Israeli settler violence and illegal settlements in the occupied West Bank, but Labor MP Julian Hill says "stern words" are not enough and the government should move to block any funding that helps establish settlements.

title.children: Labor backbencher calls for ban on Australians funding illegal Israeli settlements

image.altText: a man pushes the button on a washing machine that's full of clothes

props.synopsis: Clothes shed microfibres while they are manufactured, worn and disposed of, butÂ especially when they are washed. A single wash load can releaseÂ several million microfibres â but you can decrease this by changing your technique.

title.children: Laundry is a top source of microplastic pollution â but you can clean your clothes more sustainably

image.altText: Royal couple at their wedding looking at each other sitting on gold thrones.

props.synopsis: Once described as Asia's most eligible bachelor, Brunei's Prince Abdul Mateen, the son of one of the worldâs richest men, ties the knot in a lavish 10-day affair.

title.children: 'Heartbreak' for royal fans as Asia's most eligible prince marries in lavish 10-day celebration

image.altText: A fan with silver facepaint looks on during an NFL match

props.synopsis: The Detroit Lions have won their first NFL playoff game since 1991 to end the longest finals losing streak in American football history.Â

title.children: Fans cry tears of joy as former NFL battlers end three-decade playoff drought

image.altText: A profile of former SoccerooÂ Stephen Laybutt in his playing kit smiling

props.synopsis: The body of former Socceroos player Stephen Laybutt is found in bushland by police after he was reported missing in Casuarina.

title.children: Former Socceroos player Stephen Laybutt found dead in northern NSW

image.altText: A photo taken from above of four people doing a jigsaw puzzle together on a black table

props.synopsis: We take a look at some of the latest research on keeping your brain healthy and reducing the risk of dementia.

title.children: Ways to reduce the risk of dementia and improve brain health that may surprise you

image.altText: an aerial shot of a boat ramp and small jetty

props.synopsis: Police have revealed a man who died on the Gippsland coast last week, one of three who drowned in separate incidents, was a freediver who had lost his fins.

title.children: Freediver lost fins before drowning during tragic day off the coast of Victoria, police say

props.synopsis: Beach safety expert Professor Rob Brander explains what flash rips are and how swimmers can stay safe if they are caught in one.

title.children: What to do if you get caught in a 'tricky and unpredictable' flash rip

image.altText: A very small jellyfish with four tentacles

props.synopsis: As visitor numbers surge on K'gari (Fraser Island) during holidays, so too does the number of interactions withÂ dangerous creatures in the area, as authorities reiterate safety messages about wildlife.

title.children: Dingo bite and jellyfish stings on K'gari (Fraser Island) leave a number of adults and children in hospital

image.altText: a clinic worker testing a specimen in a lab

props.synopsis: Canberra's fixed pill-testing site encountered three drugs that staff could not identify. So, the substances were sent to chemists at the Australian National University.Â

title.children: Chemists expose three previously unknown recreational drugs after users put forward mysterious substances

image.altText: Flames engulf US flag held up in sand

props.synopsis: The Iran-backed Lebanese militant group Hezbollah says US actions in the Red Sea are harming the security of shipping, with the area becoming a "theatre of fighting".

title.children: Hezbollah says US/UK strikes on Houthis have turned Red Sea into conflict zone

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka looks to her left during his first-round match at the 2024 Australian Open.

props.synopsis: While taking the side of her fellow players, Coco Gauff says she can also understand the pressure Australian Open organisers face when scheduling the night session at Melbourne Park.

title.children: 'A fine line': Gauff joins Aus Open scheduling debate after Sabalenka match finishes beyond midnight

image.altText: A large gold symbol featuring two patterned circles next to International Court of Justice written in capital letters

props.synopsis: A compelling legal and public relations battle is underway at the International Court of Justice as two nations battle for reputation and the history books, writes John Lyons.

title.children: The question of genocide in Gaza is a battle for reputation and history

image.altText: A tiny baby turtle on the palm of a person's hand.

props.synopsis: Researchers are trying to figure out what is causing the deaths of the Mary River turtles they have spent years trying to save.

title.children: These baby turtles are tracked at faster speeds than they can swim, and researchers think they know why
